content.json:
## Log Analytics and Azure Monitor Agent Health Workbook
Use this workbook to monitor and verify Agent health for managed environments

parameters.name: UnhealthyCriteria
parameters.label: Unhealthy Criteria
parameters.jsonData:
[
    { "value":"1m", "label":"1 minute without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"5m", "label":"5 minutes without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"30m", "label":"30 minutes without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"1h", "label":"1 hour without heartbeat", "selected":true },
    { "value":"2h", "label":"2 hours without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"8h", "label":"8 hours without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"1d", "label":"1 day without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"2d", "label":"2 days without heartbeat", "selected":false },
    { "value":"7d", "label":"7 days without heartbeat", "selected":false }
]

content.query:
Resources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines'
| summarize count() by tostring(type)
| project TotalVirtualMachines = count_
content.title: Total Virtual Machines

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where Category == "Direct Agent"
| summarize AggregatedValue = dcount(Computer) by Category
content.title: Total Log Analytics Agents

content.query:
datatable(State:string, Rank:int)["Unhealthy", 0, "Healthy", 1]
| join kind = leftouter (Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Direct Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| summarize Count = dcount(Computer) by State) on State
| extend Count = iff(isempty(State1), 0, Count)
| project-away State1
| extend Rank = iff(State == 'Unhealthy' and Count == 0, 2, Rank)
| order by Rank asc
content.title: Log Analytics Agents
content.noDataMessage: Looks like you have no agents sending heartbeat information in this time range. Pick a larger time range or a different workspace.

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where Category == "Azure Monitor Agent"
| summarize AggregatedValue = dcount(Computer) by Category
content.title: Total Azure Monitor Agents

content.query:
datatable(State:string, Rank:int)["Unhealthy", 0, "Healthy", 1]
| join kind = leftouter (Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Azure Monitor Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| summarize Count = dcount(Computer) by State) on State
| extend Count = iff(isempty(State1), 0, Count)
| project-away State1
| extend Rank = iff(State == 'Unhealthy' and Count == 0, 2, Rank)
| order by Rank asc
content.title: Azure Monitor Agents
content.noDataMessage: Looks like you have no agents sending heartbeat information in this time range. Pick a larger time range or a different workspace.

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Direct Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - LastHeartbeat
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Direct Agent"
| extend Packed = pack_all()
) on Computer
| where TimeGenerated == LastHeartbeat
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Direct Agent"
| make-series InternalTrend=iff(count() > 0, 1, 0) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {UnhealthyCriteria} by Computer
| extend Trend=array_slice(InternalTrend, array_length(InternalTrend) - 30, array_length(InternalTrend)-1)
| extend (s_min, s_minId, s_max, s_maxId, s_avg, s_var, s_stdev) = series_stats(Trend)
| project Computer, Trend, s_avg
) on Computer
| order by State, s_avg asc, TimeAgo
| project ["_ComputerName_"] = Computer, ["Computer"]=strcat('🖥️ ', Computer), State, ["Environment"] = iff(ComputerEnvironment == "Azure", ComputerEnvironment, Category), ["OS"]=iff(isempty(OSName), OSType, OSName), ["Azure Resource"]=ResourceId, Version, ["Time"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), ["Heartbeat Trend"]=Trend, ["Details"]=Packed
content.title: Log Analytics Agent Details
content.noDataMessage: Looks like you have no agents sending heartbeat information to this workspace. Pick a different workspace.

tooltipFormat.tooltip: Click to see details of the last event sent by this computer.
Each bar represents the bucket of time based on the Unhealthy Criteria. Showing last 30 buckets max.

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Azure Monitor Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - LastHeartbeat
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Azure Monitor Agent"
| extend Packed = pack_all()
) on Computer
| where TimeGenerated == LastHeartbeat
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where Category =~ "Azure Monitor Agent"
| make-series InternalTrend=iff(count() > 0, 1, 0) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {UnhealthyCriteria} by Computer
| extend Trend=array_slice(InternalTrend, array_length(InternalTrend) - 30, array_length(InternalTrend)-1)
| extend (s_min, s_minId, s_max, s_maxId, s_avg, s_var, s_stdev) = series_stats(Trend)
| project Computer, Trend, s_avg
) on Computer
| order by State, s_avg asc, TimeAgo
| project ["_ComputerName_"] = Computer, ["Computer"]=strcat('🖥️ ', Computer), State, ["Environment"] = iff(ComputerEnvironment == "Azure", ComputerEnvironment, Category), ["OS"]=iff(isempty(OSName), OSType, OSName), ["Azure Resource"]=ResourceId, Version, ["Time"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), ["Heartbeat Trend"]=Trend, ["Details"]=Packed
content.title: Azure Monitor Agent Details
content.noDataMessage: Looks like you have no agents sending heartbeat information to this workspace. Pick a different workspace.

tooltipFormat.tooltip: Click to see details of the last event sent by this computer.
Each bar represents the bucket of time based on the Unhealthy Criteria. Showing last 30 buckets max.

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where Computer == "{ComputerName}"
| make-series Trend=count() default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {UnhealthyCriteria} by Computer
content.title: Heartbeat volume trend

content.query:
Resources
| join kind=leftouter (ResourceContainers | where type=='microsoft.resources/subscriptions' | project SubscriptionName=name, subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| project id, resourceGroup, SubscriptionName

Heartbeat
| where Category =~ "Direct Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by _ResourceId

Resources
| join kind=leftouter (ResourceContainers | where type=='microsoft.resources/subscriptions' | project SubscriptionName=name, subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| project id, resourceGroup, SubscriptionName

Heartbeat
| where Category == "Azure Monitor Agent"
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by _ResourceId

content.json:
# Get started

Welcome to the Azure Monitor Log Analytics agent workbook. This workbook is designed to provide you with an understanding of:
* How many agents are reporting to my workspace and how are they connected?
* What is the agent connected state? How many are actively connected and reporting and how many aren't?
* Are any Windows agents affecting the resource utlization of the host?

You can drill-down to review the heartbeat trend for a selected agent machine, and its performance utilization (only available on Windows operating system at this time).

The following tabs include performance charts that show resource utilization from the agent's related processes:

1. **Health Service** - The *HealthService* is the primary agent process responsible for maintaining communication between the agent and Azure Monitor, downloading configuration based on insights and solutions enabled in the workspace, processing the configuration, and sending data collected to a Log Analytics workspace. 
2. **Monitoring Host** - The *MonitoringHost* is a child monitoring host process responsible for performing monitoring activities defined in the downloaded configuration from Azure Monitor, such as:

    * Monitoring and collecting Windows event log data.
    * Monitoring and collecting Log-based file data.
    * Monitoring and collecting performance counter data.

For additional information about the Log Analytics agent, see [agent overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agents-overview#log-analytics-agent).


## Requirements

* A [Log Analytics workspace](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/design-logs-deployment).

In order to analyze the performance utlization of the Log Analytics Windows agent, you need to enable the collection of the following performance counters:
* Health Service Management Groups(*)\Send Queue % Used 
* Health Service(*)\Module Count
* Health Service(*)\Workflow Count 
* Process(HealthService)\% Processor Time 
* Process(HealthService)\Handle Count 
* Process(HealthService)\Private Bytes 
* Process(MonitoringHost*)\% Processor Time 
* Process(MonitoringHost*)\Private Bytes 

If you are unfamiliar with how to enable performance counters in your workspace, see [Configure performance data source](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-sources-performance-counters#configuring-data-sources).

content.query:
Resources| where type =~ 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines'
| project Computer = name, subscriptionId, Status=properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.displayStatus
|join kind=leftouter(
Resources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions'
| where name == '{ExtensionName}'
| extend Computer = tostring(split(id, "/")[8]) 
| extend ProvisioningState=properties.provisioningState| extend AutoUpgrade = properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade| extend HandlerVersion=properties.typeHandlerVersion| extend EnableAMA=properties.settings.enableAMA
| project subscriptionId, Computer, name, ProvisioningState, AutoUpgrade, HandlerVersion, EnableAMA, properties) on Computer, subscriptionId
| project-away subscriptionId1, Computer1

Resources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines'
| where name == 'Manager1'
| extend Computer = tostring(split(id, "/")[8]) 
| extend IdentityTypes=tostring(identity.type)| extend UserAssignedIdentities=identity.userAssignedIdentities
| summarize UserManager1 = countif(identity contains "Manager1"), UserTenantVMs = countif(identity contains "TenantVMs") by subscriptionId, id, IdentityTypes

Resources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines'
| where name != 'Manager1'
| extend Computer = tostring(split(id, "/")[8]) 
| extend IdentityTypes=tostring(identity.type)| extend UserAssignedIdentities=identity.userAssignedIdentities
| summarize UserTenantVMs = countif(identity contains "TenantVMs") by subscriptionId, id, IdentityTypes

content.json:
Original Workbooks - Log Analytics Agent Health  / Avery and Blair's merged Workbooks
